Chapter 8.8:22: 22 As long as the world exists, there will be a time for planting and a time for harvest. There will always be cold and heat, summer and winter, day and night.”

Chapter 9.9:19: 19 These three sons of Noah were the ancestors of all the people on earth.

Chapter 9.9:20: 20 Noah, who was a farmer, was the first man to plant a vineyard.

Chapter 9.9:21: 21 After he drank some of the wine, he became drunk, took off his clothes, and lay naked in his tent.

Chapter 9.9:22: 22 When Ham, the father of Canaan, saw that his father was naked, he went out and told his two brothers.

Chapter 9.9:23: 23 Then Shem and Japheth took a robe and held it behind them on their shoulders. They walked backward into the tent and covered their father, keeping their faces turned away so as not to see him naked.

Chapter 9.9:24: 24 When Noah sobered up and learned what his youngest son had done to him,

Chapter 9.9:26: 26 Give praise to the Lord, the God of Shem!

Chapter 9.9:27: 27 May God cause Japheth[a] to increase!

Chapter 9.9:28: 28 After the flood Noah lived 350 years

Chapter 9.9:29: 29 and died at the age of 950.
